### 

The goal of the Bard Network Computing Initiative (BNCI) is to support delivery of and expansion of computing and data analysis activities throughout the Bard Network.  The Bard Network includes the [Bard Early College](https://bhsec.bard.edu/) program and the institutions of the [Global Higher Education Alliance for the 21st Century](https://ghea21.org/).

### What do we do?

Work of the BNCI is support by and carried out in concert with the [Computational Sciences program](https://cs.bard.edu/) at Bard College.  Activities of the BNCI include:

  - Modules developed for and delivered in courses across the disciplines at Bard College and throughout the network:

| Course Title  |      Module      |
|---------------|------------------|
| Intro to Media | Media consolidation, personal data, and algorithmic bias |
| Epidemics & Society | Modeling and visualization of disease spread and vaccine efficacy |
| Intro to Community Sciences | Air and water quality data analysis |
| Problems of Archaeological Archives | Text analysis, expanded spreadsheet analysis |
| Introduction to Physics | Statistical analysis and data manipulation |

: {tbl-colwidths="[35, 65]"}

  - Senior project support for students with data analysis challenges

  - Short courses on Statistics, Geographic Information Systems, Data Visualization
  
  - Network Collaborative Courses for students across GHEA21

  - (planned for Bard College) On-campus Data Analysis Support Center




### Who's Who

The Director of the BNCI is [Valerie Barr](https://vbarr4.github.io/), the [Margaret Hamilton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margaret_Hamilton_(software_engineer)) Distinguished Professor of Computer Science at [Bard College](http://www.bard.edu/). 

[Jordan Ayala](https://jayalakc.github.io/), Visiting Assistant Professor of Data Analytics and Environmental Studies, is a key brain-stormer and contributor to the BNCI, working on development of modules, short courses, and senior project support.
